document.docTitle: Sisicus volutasilex Dupérré & Paquin, 2007, new species
document.masterDocTitle: Description of five new spiders from Canada (Araneae: Linyphiidae)

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 21–29.
Sisicus volutasilex
new species . 21, palpus of male, ventral view; 22, palpus of male, retrolateral view; 23, male palpal tibia, dorsal view; 24, expanded male palpus, schematic illustration; 25, male cephalothorax, dorsal view; 26 male cephalothorax, lateral view; 27, epigynum, ventral view; 28, spermathecae, ventral view; 29, spermathecae, dorsal view. Scale bars for figures 21–24, 27–29= 0.05 mm; 25, 26 =0.5 mm. Abbreviations used as figures 1–9.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Habitat. Deciduous and coniferous forest litter. Most specimens were collected in the subnivean space (under snow) with the winter pitfall technique of
Paquin ( 2004 )
.

Etymology. The epithet is formed by the contraction of volutabundus, a, um : rolling, and silex : pebble/ stone, because the shape of the epigynum closely resembles the tongue logo used by the rock band the Rolling Stones.
